p: We estimated the multimodel ensemble mean changes in the flow duration curves and streamflow under the projected future climate (Fig. 4). While the intermodel uncertainty in changes is substantial (Fig. 4), we find that the flow duration curves for Bhakra Nangal and Nathpa Jhakri show a negligible change in flow under the RCP 2.6 (Fig. 4a,b). In contrast to the low warming scenario (RCP 2.6), flow is projected to increase for Bhakra Nangal and Nathpa Jhakri under the RCP 8.5 (Fig. 4h,i). High flow (probability of exceedance in time less than 10%) is projected to increase substantially in all the reservoirs at the end of the 21 st century in RCP 8.5 scenario (Fig. 4). Moreover, mean annual streamflow is projected to increase for all the reservoirs by the end of the 21 st century (Table S5, Figs S4– S6). The projected increase in streamflow varies between 25.30 ± 22.7% (Hirakund) and 44.75 ± 35.9% (Nagarjuna Sagar) at the end of the 21 st century under RCP 8.5 (Table S5).
